author: jessesawa
content:
I've noticed a limitation with per-transaction signed messages: contracts cannot verify if a signature is tied to the current transaction.

The following idea has been mentioned before, but with different motivations and not much traction. I'd like to resurface creating a new opcode for the transaction nonce again.

Use cases:

(Primary motivation) Address attestations up to a given transaction count: These attestations can be used for purposes like detecting illicit activity or one-time identity verification.

(Mentioned earlier) Future CREATE addresses.

(Just a thought) Off-chain transaction ordering: Transactions would only be valid if submitted in the agreed-upon order.


Thoughts/questions are appreciated!
